title: Reminiscences of childhood at Inverkeithing;
author: Simson, James
snippet: The little village called Hillend, near the upper end of Letham Hill (which is said to be now entirely occupied  by Irish), is associated in my memory mainly with its teacher, of the name of Scotland, having been thrashed by his scholars ; and by the second boy of the family asking "if it was Scotland o' Hillend that was told to draw the sword," on hearing our maid singing, " Draw the sword, Scotland."
